attributes.action: address care for dementia as a response to the Shipman Inquiry
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The National Audit Office reported that in the UK, dementia costs £17bn yearly

- David Nicholson, NHS chief executive, said that the UK was in the bottom third of Europe in delivering high quality dementia care

- The number of people with dementia is expected to soar from 700,000 today to over one million by 2025

The petitioner would like to ask if anything more can be done to help this vulnerable group in society ?
